Background and Early Life

Zixiang Zhou was born in Beijing, China, in 2004 and moved to Canada with his family in 2014. He attended University Heights Public School in London, Ontario, where his aptitude for mathematics and computer science became evident at a young age. By grade 8, Zhou was already competing in high-level national and international contests, laying the foundation for his future success in competitive programming. His early engagement with math challenges (such as those at Western University) and programming problems fueled his rapid development as a competitor.

Competitive Programming Achievements

Zhou’s competitive programming career is marked by a series of impressive accomplishments that set him apart in the field. Here are some highlights:

  • International Olympiad in Informatics (IOI):

    • In IOI 2020, he secured a gold medal, finishing 20th out of over 340 participants from 87 countries, showcasing his ability to tackle complex algorithmic challenges under pressure.
  • Codeforces Success:
    • Zhou competes on Codeforces under the handle “duality”, where he has achieved extraordinary success.
    • As of May 2025, his contest rating stands at 3023, with a maximum rating of 3341, earning him the prestigious rank of legendary grandmaster—the highest tier on the platform.
    • He has solved 1180 problems on Codeforces, reflecting his consistent effort and deep expertise in algorithms and data structures.
  • Other Notable Contests:
    • In October 2021, Zhou won the University of Waterloo Local Contest, a regional collegiate programming event, demonstrating his dominance in local competitions.
    • He also achieved a perfect score of 600 points in the 2021 Iran National OI Team Selection Online Mirror Competition, a feat that underscored his exceptional skill and led to an insightful interview on Codeforces where he shared tips for aspiring programmers.
